arts.ttl: Thomas Frank Responds to Tottenham Fans Booing Mathys Tel After 2-2 Man Utd
arts.sum: Thomas Frank has reacted to Tottenham fans booing Mathys Tel substitution against Manchester United.

arts.ttl: Sesko, Casemiro, Maguire, Mainoo - Man Utd injury news after triple blow vs Tottenham
arts.sum: Manchester United rescued a point in the final stages of their Premier League match with Tottenham, but there were one or two fresh injury set-backs for Ruben Amorim.

arts.ttl: How stoppage-time chaos was born from Spurs and Man Utd’s obvious problems
arts.sum: Tottenham 2-2 Manchester United: There was a sense of inevitablity about the final result which was a very direct product of the obvious issues both sides have

arts.ttl: Explosive ending cannot mask flaws of Tottenham and Manchester United | Jonathan Wilson
arts.athr: Jonathan Wilson at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium
arts.sum: This match was as dismal as last season’s Europa League final and in a routine league game nerves are no excuse Never underestimate the haplessness of this Manchester United. Never underestimate the haplessness of this Tottenham Hotspur. Never underestimate the capacity of the Premier League to uncover drama in the least plausible situation. The embers of a game of little quality seemed cold and dead but somehow burst into glorious flame in the final six minutes plus injury time. What it means is anybody’s guess, other than that these are two sides who remain deeply flawed. The shadow of Bilbao and last May’s Europa League final was unavoidable; in purely technical terms, that game was just as bad as the first 84 minutes of this one, but it at least had a sense of edge. Nervousness is permissible if there is something to be nervous about. Such scrappiness in a routine Premier League meeting is far less explicable. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Ruben Amorim says what he’d like to do in January after Man Utd draw at Spurs
arts.sum: United were 1-0 up and set for a fifth win in seven matches before a dramatic final in north London.

arts.ttl: Spurs star ‘mad’ after ‘losing two points’ to late Man Utd goal
arts.sum: Spurs attacker Mathys Tel admitted the team is “mad” after they failed to hold on for the win against Man Utd in the Premier League on Saturday. Bryan Mbeumo opened the scoring in the first half at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, but the hosts fought back with two late goals. arts.ttl: Man Utd next five fixtures compared to Liverpool, Arsenal and more after dramatic Spurs draw
arts.sum: Manchester United stretched their unbeaten run to five games in the Premier League after Matthijs de Ligt's late equaliser at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium on Saturday

arts.ttl: Alan Shearer sticks the boot in on Man Utd AND Tottenham after dramatic draw
arts.sum: Manchester United and Tottenham Hotspur battled to a dramatic 2-2 draw in North London on Saturday afternoon with Alan Shearer far from happy with the performances of both sides
